results.content: I walk slowly, but I never walk backward.
results.author: Abraham Lincoln

results.content: Truth is generally the best vindication against slander.
results.author: Abraham Lincoln

results.content: A house divided against itself cannot stand.
results.author: Abraham Lincoln

results.content: Character is like a tree and reputation like a shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing.
results.author: Abraham Lincoln

results.content: I destroy my enemies when I make them my friends.
results.author: Abraham Lincoln

results.content: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
results.author: Abraham Lincoln

results.content: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any one thing.
results.author: Abraham Lincoln

results.content: What is necessary to change a person is to change his awareness of himself.
results.author: Abraham Maslow

results.content: If you only have a hammer, you tend to see every problem as a nail.
results.author: Abraham Maslow

results.content: When you have got an elephant by the hind legs and he is trying to run away, it's best to let him run.
results.author: Abraham Lincoln

results.content: You have to do your own growing no matter how tall your grandfather was.
results.author: Abraham Lincoln

results.content: Most people are about as happy as they make up their minds to be
results.author: Abraham Lincoln

results.content: Be sure you put your feet in the right place, then stand firm.
results.author: Abraham Lincoln

results.content: I will prepare and some day my chance will come.
results.author: Abraham Lincoln

results.content: Important principles may, and must, be inflexible.
results.author: Abraham Lincoln

results.content: The best thing about the future is that it only comes one day at a time.
results.author: Abraham Lincoln
